com.example.cshare.webservices

Interface ProductAPI


  • public interface ProductAPI
    Interface that defines the product-related API endpoints.

    Provides endpoints to retrieve products, to add a new product, or to delete an existing product.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Clara Gros, Babacar Toure

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      retrofit2.Call<Product> addProduct(java.lang.String token, okhttp3.MultipartBody.Part product_picture, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String category, java.lang.String quantity, java.lang.String expiration_date)
      Returns a Call object that contains the response to the API's addProduct request.
      retrofit2.Call<Product> deleteProduct(java.lang.String token, int productID)
      Returns a Call object that contains the response to the API's deleteProduct request.
      retrofit2.Call<ProductListResponse.ApiProductListResponse> getProducts(java.lang.String token, java.lang.String status, java.lang.String category, int shared, int page)
      Returns a Call object that contains the response to the API's getProducts request.

    • Method Detail

      • getProducts

        @GET(value="product/")
retrofit2.Call<ProductListResponse.ApiProductListResponse> getProducts(@Header(value="Authorization")
                                                                                              java.lang.String token,
                                                                                              @Query(value="status")
                                                                                              java.lang.String status,
                                                                                              @Query(value="category")
                                                                                              java.lang.String category,
                                                                                              @Query(value="shared")
                                                                                              int shared,
                                                                                              @Query(value="page")
                                                                                              int page)
        Returns a Call object that contains the response to the API's getProducts request.
        Parameters:
        token - (String) of the form "token eyJ0eXAiOiAianFsZyI6ICJIUzUxMiJ9", it corresponds to the token of the authenticated user and it is passed in the request header
        status - (String) Product status (query parameter in the url)
        category - (String) Product category (query parameter in the url)
        shared - (int) if true (1), retrieve shared products (query parameter in the url)
        page - (int) number of the page to display (query parameter in the url)
        Returns:
        (Call) A Call object containing the product list and pagination information in a ProductListResponse.ApiProductListResponse object
        See Also:
        ProductListResponse.ApiProductListResponse, HomeDataSource

      • addProduct

        @Multipart
 @POST(value="product/")
retrofit2.Call<Product> addProduct(@Header(value="Authorization")
                                                                       java.lang.String token,
                                                                       @Part
                                                                       okhttp3.MultipartBody.Part product_picture,
                                                                       @Part(value="name")
                                                                       java.lang.String name,
                                                                       @Part(value="category")
                                                                       java.lang.String category,
                                                                       @Part(value="quantity")
                                                                       java.lang.String quantity,
                                                                       @Part(value="expiration_date")
                                                                       java.lang.String expiration_date)
        Returns a Call object that contains the response to the API's addProduct request.
        Parameters:
        token - (String) of the form "token eyJ0eXAiOiAianFsZyI6ICJIUzUxMiJ9", it corresponds to the token of the authenticated user and it is passed in the request header
        product_picture - (Image) Mandatory product picture (request body)
        name - (String) name of the added product (request body)
        category - (String) product category (request body)
        quantity - (String) product quantity (request body)
        expiration_date - (String) expiration date (with format YYYY-MM-DD) (request body)
        Returns:
        (Call) A Call object containing the added product in a Product object
        See Also:
        Product, ProductRequestManager.addProduct(Product)

      • deleteProduct

        @DELETE(value="product/{id}/")
retrofit2.Call<Product> deleteProduct(@Header(value="Authorization")
                                                                     java.lang.String token,
                                                                     @Path(value="id")
                                                                     int productID)
        Returns a Call object that contains the response to the API's deleteProduct request.
        Parameters:
        token - (String) of the form "token eyJ0eXAiOiAianFsZyI6ICJIUzUxMiJ9", it corresponds to the token of the authenticated user and it is passed in the request header
        productID - (int) corresponds to the id of the product to delete in the url
        Returns:
        (Call) A Call object containing the deleted product in a Product object
        See Also:
        Product, ProductRequestManager.deleteProduct(int)
